newsitem.title: DOMINICAN REPUBLIC: Six injured in Dominican Republic strike.
newsitem.headline: Six injured in Dominican Republic strike.

text.p: Six people were injured on Tuesday in clashes between protestors and police as a 24-hour strike hit parts of the Dominican capital and several southern areas, police and radio reports said.
Transport and other workers called the strike to demand a lower cost of living and creation of more jobs.
Central Santo Domingo was calm, with the strike winning support mostly in outlying parts of the city.

Radio reports and local journalists in the southern town of San Juan de la Maguana said the strike closed businesses and paralysed public transport there. They said three people were hurt by flying rocks, up to 80 detained and one vehicle was set on fire.
Police reinforcements were sent to areas affected by the strike and Police Chief Miguel Sanz Jiminian said he would guarantee public order and protect businesses.
President Leonel Fernandez told a news conference that the strikers were "remnants of the left" out of touch with political realities in Latin America.
Last week, separate strikes by protesting workers in the Dominican Republic turned violent and left at least one person dead and three wounded.
